poem:
**Eclectic Ensemble**

In the fog of London's streets,  
stars gather. Jerry whispers  
secrets in soft silk,  
while Romeo's shadow flits—  
youth dressed in bold angles.  
Prue conjures flavors,  
Lucy's grace a shadow brisk  
in Marina's seamless whispers.  
Jewels clink, a chorus—  
the city's pulse threads them,  
a fleeting kaleidoscope  
of art-woven light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From Prue Leith to Romeo Beckham and Lucy Bronze, London fashion week is hard to beat Where else can you find Jerry Hall, Romeo Beckham, Prue Leith, Barbara Hepworth, Robert Mapplethorpe, Lucy Bronze and Marina Abramović all in one place? For an eclectic cast of characters, London fashion week is hard to beat. Hall starred as a “diva psychic”, using clairvoyant powers to hawk bracelets in a short play by Laura Waldren staged by jewellery". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: From Prue Leith to Romeo Beckham and Lucy Bronze, London fashion week is hard to beat Where else can you find Jerry Hall, Romeo Beckham, Prue Leith, Barbara Hepworth, Robert Mapplethorpe, Lucy Bronze and Marina Abramović all in one place? For an eclectic cast of characters, London fashion week is hard to beat. Hall starred as a “diva psychic”, using clairvoyant powers to hawk bracelets in a short play by Laura Waldren staged by jewellery
